intro: Fagelia stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf fagelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Fagelia stricta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
